Reviews.Title: It Was (Nearly) Everything I Needed
Reviews.Author: J. Caruso
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying I am a loyal Canon shooter. I own both film and digital SLRs and love them very much. When I needed a digital point and shoot to carry with me whenever carrying the DSLR was impractical, I saved my pennies and bought a G9. The G9 is a fantastic point and shoot which I highly recommend.So why am I writing a review for the Panasonic DMC-LZ10? Well, about a week ago, I dropped my G9 and the lens was stuck in the open position. I have to send it in to Canon for repair. In the interim, however, I didn't want to be without a digital point and shoot. I also didn't want to spend a boat-load of money. My first instinct was to get another Canon. I tried several of the lower-cost versions, in particular the A590Is. It's a fine camera, and I liked the IQ enough (but not as much as my G9). I didn't like the feel of it in my hand or the fact that it felt a bit flimsy. So I began to look around...and at other brands.During my research, the Lumix line kept popping up. I became curious. I did more, specific research. I then found that the LZ10 fulfilled nearly all of my needs/wants:1) Cost--I wasn't going to spend and arm and a leg on a camera that would be used pretty much while another was in the shop.2) Size--I wanted a camera small enough to take alone without being intrusive.3) IQ--I wanted a camera that was able to create photographs with good, usable image quality. I wanted low noise and good resolution. I wasn't going to fool myself into thinking I'd get DSLR quality, but I also didn't want to fool around with "project" photos.4) Control Beyond Pre-Set "Scenes"--I am very fond of being able to shoot in shutter priority, aperture priority, and manual. I will occasionally use Program mode, but often eschew the "Scene" or "Creative" modes.5) Build Quality--I like to USE my cameras, and I tote them along with me every day. Build quality is an important issue.6) File Format--In a perfect world I would love to have RAW capability.7) Battery--The propitiatory batter in my G9 wasn't as much of an issue because it uses the same batteries found in my older DSLR...batteries I already had but haven't been using. I wasn't interested in starting a whole new battery collection, so standard AAs were very appealing.8) Looks--Yes, a little bit of vanity creeps in now and again.So, how does the DMC-LZ10 stack up? Pretty darned favorably I have to say.1) Cost--It was right in my wheelhouse. I feel it is a good value for the money.2) Size--The camera is surprisingly small without feeling teeny. The ergonomics are good...it feels "right" in the hand.3) IQ--For a camera in this price range, I am very pleased with the image quality. The anti-shake works well, and my over-all hit-to-miss ratio is very favorable. The Leica lens is a good performer (although the photos will never be mistaken for those taken with an M8) and the wide angle end is very serviceable at 30mm (equivalent).4) Control Beyond Pre-Set "Scenes"--Yup...it has shutter priority, aperture priority, manual, and program modes. Sure, it also has all the "Creative" and "Scene" modes, as well as Panasoinc's "Intelligent Automatic" which really does a lot of thinking for you.5) Build Quality--Unlike the Canon A590Is, The DMC-LZ10 has a predominantly metal body and feels substantial.6) File Format--Here is where the camera lets me down a bit. There is no RAW support, only JPG.7) Battery--Double A batteries it is. I got some Eneloops and they work wonderfully.8) Looks--I have to admit this camera does LOOK good. It's sleek, with a hint of a retro feel that I really like.So in the end, I am very happy with my choice to get the Lumix DMC-LZ10. So happy, in fact, that I do not plan on shelving it once my G9 returns from the shop. I want to find some way to put it to use in my daily work flow.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic LZ10K
Reviews.Author: D. Wall
Reviews.Content: This is not your old Kodak instamatic camera, although it looks like one. This camera is miniature. Fits into any pocket or the palm of your hand. It comes with all the bells and whistles you need to take a variety of different lighting condition photographs. I chose this camera over some of the other Panasonic cameras because it allows for a manual setting for aperture and shutter speeds. Additionally it allows for timed exposure shots. So I would suggest this camera for someone a tad bit advanced in the knowledge of photography. The zoom is good and the image stabilization works fine. Over all I would give this camera an 8 out of 10.  I took off 1 point because Panasonic could have fit a 3 inch viewing screen on the back rather than a 2 ½ inch and another point off for battery consumption. Keep a few batteries on hand

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: C. Clement
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on the recommdation of my brother.  He does a lot of photography and said it was one of the best priced cameras with the leica lens.  I love it.  The pictures come out with so much clarity.  The camera picks up details that I can't see with my own eyes.  The video capabilities are nice too.  I purchased this with the additional memory card and rechargeable batteries.

Reviews.Title: Excelent cost/performance rate
Reviews.Author: E. Mata Montero
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-LZ10S is an excellent product. Excellent price for a ton of features. Nevertheless, one feature that it does not have and I wish I had paid attention to before purchasing it is that it only has a digital viewfinder (not the traditional little window through which you aim at your target). In my outdoors trips on sunny days this was a major drawback. The surface of the digital viewfinder is very reflective and thus, rather than clearly seeing the target I see my own face. Additionaly, because you cannot turn the digital viewfinder off, it consumes more battery power than other digital cameras I had in the past. Otherwise, I would have given it five stars.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional features for this price!!!
Reviews.Author: Rohit Chauhan
Reviews.Content: I waited for 5 days, and got a 10 megapixel, 5x optical zoom and a 30mm wide angle optically stabilized leica lens. All this along with P, A, S, M modes which are hard to find in such point and shooot cameras. Well on paper it seems great and actually unbeatable at the price at which it is offered. So, I wont take long and will come to the point.The cons:-> Slight shutter lag and screen blackout after a photograph (annoying).-> Takes a bit longer to focus while not in quick focus mode.-> Use of AA batteries (it can be of an advantage to few but for me its not much).-> Grip (there should have been a rubber or something instead of hard grey plastic in it).-> If I get too complaining, I'd say the wrist strap is placed on a wrong place, it should have been somewhere on the lower right side of the camera (but again it maybe just me who doesnt likes that).Now the pros:-> Good image quality with assistance of optical stabilization.-> Nice and easy to use with an intutive intelligent auto mode.-> Good control with A, S, M modes for more knowledgable photographers (im kinda working on it).-> 30mm wide angle is really handy in tight locations.-> Nice flash range with good focussing even in low light situations.-> Good widescreen videos (if you don't compare them to a camcorder).Overall, if you want a "has it all" kind of a camera which can do almost anything with a minimal budget. This is your pic then. I have it from past 3 days and yet have a few things to discover about it.

Reviews.Title: Great Choice
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Watkins
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix DMC-LZ10K 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)I have only had this camera for a few days but it has exceeded all expectations.  Before this my favorite still camera was another Panasonic, the 8 Meg but this one is a third the size is 10 Mp and has all of the features of the bigger camera.  With the Panasonic HD video camera you can carry High quality camera gear that used to require a wheeled cart in your pockets.  Read the tech reviews for the details but give this camera a lot of thought.  I find no downside to it at all.

Reviews.Title: $[...] ...Are you serious...What a steal
Reviews.Author: R. Eldredge "Blacked-out barbecuer"
Reviews.Content: I searched FOREVA  on line trying to find the right camera for me. Most important factor ,to keep it simple is - look for the highest optical zoom range in your price range. Digital zoom ..ehhh is overated. The pictures become a little blurry fully zoomed. I used a 7 megapixel camera prior to purchasing this Lumix and I thought it was great (Sony powershot I think with 4 times optical zoom) Took a picture with this camera in the dark -no lights Results were incredible You would think it was taken in daylight ..Great video .Listen If your looking for high end ..spend a 800 bucks If you want a GREAT buy this is it  Highly recommend this camera Good luck and stop procrastinating and click the buy button  Enjoy !!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC LZ10
Reviews.Author: Steven Lee Karsten
Reviews.Content: This camera is probably about the best one you can find with the options it has for the price.Takes incredibly good pictures.  I use it mainly for city scapes, but it also did incredibly well at a my morning jacket concert.  Videos are also incredibly easy to take and the microphone takes surprisingly good audio.  10 MP for 140 bucks?  What are you waiting for?Love this camera!

Reviews.Title: A Really Great Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Hopper
Reviews.Content: This camera has excellent video recording capabilities, and it does a very good job with image stabilization.  The pictures are quite clear, and the various setting are user-friendly for a variety of situations.  The setting are arranged in a logical way on the camera, which made it very easy to learn to operate.  It does not suck battery life up, which makes for less need to carry along lots of extra batteries.  I would highly recommend this camera to someone who does not do "high end" photography for a living but still would like "high end" looking results!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic LUMIX DCM-LZ10K
Reviews.Author: James M. Reaves "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the variety of features.  I especially like the Leica lens & it even looks similar ro a Leica.  Also, I purchased this camera for a FANTASTIC price.  I took it out of the box, installed the batteries, reviewed the various "bells & whistles" on the camera, & began shooting.... oh yeah, picture clarity it 3 times as good as the more expensive Olympus that I've been using.

Reviews.Title: Not up to the task
Reviews.Author: R. Beck
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace our older Fuji FinePix550 which has seen better days.  We immediately noticed that the Panasonic took longer to start up, focus, and shoot.  In fact, it was very difficult for us to take candid shots because the delay between flash-shutter-display was a good 2 to 3 seconds.  My wife has commented that she prefers the older Fuji, and I tend to agree.As far as quality of the images, it seems indor shots taken with a flash come out with an orange hue.  However, the features on this camera (including the OIS) seem to allow for crisper pictures overall.  If it wasn't for the long delay between snaping pics, we probably could live with the other minor short comings.On the positive side, this cammera took really nice motion pictures in both 16x9 and 4x3 aspect ratios, but they were in MOV format which requires the instalation of QuickTime on your PC (as opposed to AVI which can be handled by WMP).  And the multiple picure aspect ratios were also appreciated.Overall, this camera is being returned, and my search for the Fuji continues!

Reviews.Title: Less than impressed
Reviews.Author: F. Morgan
Reviews.Content: The camera is great for snapshots.  Its megapixel size of 10mb was dissapointing, as pictures appear to be out of focused when you "zoom" in on a picture taken with it.  Its 5x optical zoom is a nice feature. The user interface is fairly good, but not completely intuitive (as sometimes you have to refer back to the manual to figure out how to do some functions that you seldom use).  The face detection is neat, in the sense that it does seem to pick out the faces in the picture, however does it seem to make a differance in doing so?  I'm not so sure.  This is a case of value for your money...don't buy this for the megapixels, or the lens, or the stabilized zoom individually...buy this because it's a good compromise on all three areas for a reasonable price.  The build quality of the camera is good.  The bumpout on the left side (as you face the camera) provides a good hand hold - yet the camera easily fits in your shirt pocket.  Some of the other cameras, are so small, that its becomes an issue in easily holding the camera to take a picture.  I like the camera, its just that for the price it wasn't exceptional.

Reviews.Title: Budget cam with higher than average feature set
Reviews.Author: Sheryar  Singha
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace my aging Canon Powershot A Series camera naturally leaning towards the A590IS but wondered what competitors  had to offer. It didn't take long to see the Panasonic LZ (long zoom) series keep getting mentioned and after some quick research I could see why.Like the Canons, this series accepts AA batteries, has manual focus, a sturdy body and image stabilization  - pretty standard features for even budget cameras today. However the LZ series adds a 5X optical zoom (best in class), auto bracketing (takes pictures slightly differing exposure levels to ensure a quality shot) and a wider range of video controls than its competitors. I had settled on an LZ8 at Amazon but picked up an LZ10 for the same price from Dell.After a few days of playing with the camera I feel extremely satisfied with my choice. The test shots I've taken have mostly been indoors or just outside the house in the evening. The images have consistently been well exposed and the live preview histogram a bonus. I find the Auto Mode adequate for everyday surroundings and love the fact that the preset "SCENE" modes also have an advanced feature settings for further customization - a nice touch. The 2.5 inch LCD (with variable brightness) makes framing a snap. You can capture images in widescreen format allowing for easy displaying on your HDTV. Panasonic's Quick Menu system is intuitive and makes changing settings a breeze. Sadly, there is no optical viewfinder.For around a $100 the LZ8/LZ10 seem hard to beat at this time.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful little camera
Reviews.Author: B. H. Kucuk "Enprovenced"
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice if you want some power over the photo you are taking. The camera handles like a high end 35mm compact, and has a limited but substantial range of options. I was not that impressed with the "Intelligent" point-and-shoot function on the camera. I often use it on manual. Go with the 100 ISO setting and the pictures come out beautifully. Otherwise, pixel-level quality tends to be quite low. Then again, low-light shooting is a problem with practically every digital compact.The dials on the camera are pretty nice; this way, you don't have to scroll through menus for the settings that have to be tweaked on the go for the specific picture you are taking. It also saves your settings for each mode, which is incredibly useful. You don't lose your optimized arrangement on the manual when you switch to, say, extended exposure at night. If you are not going to go for the SLR, just buy this one and don't waste your money on a $400 compact.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Sewing Snit
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Takes great pictures, even on the automatic settings, the pictures are so clear!  I love it.  I am not a tech person and can use this camera easily.The best pictures I have ever taken in my life.

Reviews.Title: Very adaptive
Reviews.Author: Tere
Reviews.Content: This is my first digicam and so I'm a novice and loving this camera.  At it's easiest, you can trust Intelligent Auto Mode to take a great picture most of the time.  But it's also very user-friendly and I'm quickly learning to go beyond the basic settings and play with other modes, functions and settings.  The shots are great quality and look fabulous online or printed.  The instruction manual is very easy to follow and learn from when you are ready to get into some more advanced operations.  I would highly recommend this camera as a tool for beginners that are interested in starting with something not overly complicated, but that also offers the capacity to learn and grow.

Reviews.Title: Trip to Europe
Reviews.Author: Mister A
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded my expectations.  It delivers wonderful pictures.The settings are easily mastered and simple to use.  My wife and I lovethe shots we took over the last two weeks.  Scenery and architectureshots are great

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Palka
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use.The wide angle lens takes great family pictures, you can get all the family in the picture.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Ray "Ray C."
Reviews.Content: I have had the Lumix DMC-LZ10S for one week and I love it. For the price you just can't beat the LZ10. Some twice charged Radio Shack AA NiMH rechargeable batteries and I am working on my 125Th picture and about 15 minutes of video on a single charge and the battery indicator sill shows full. I added a 2 GB memory card so I have about 300 more before that is full. The only draw back, that is more of just an irritant, is you cannot pick an choose what pictures you want to download. Any pictures on the camera that are not in the receiving file on your PC will be downloaded. So you have to keep any pictures you want to keep in your camera on the file you download into even if, like in my case you want to keep about 100 or so just to show people. The camera also came with a Panorama program that is very cool. You can probably get a better camera for 3 or 4 hundred dollars but for $149 you can't go wrong. I do not have much experience with digital cameras but I have shown it to people that do and they have all had rave reviews

Reviews.Title: happy
Reviews.Author: Schralping "pow"
Reviews.Content: I can't say that I am even remotely familiar with all of the features of the camera but I brought it down to Southern Utah and gave it a good workout.  The images came out very clear and were quite striking with the wide-angle shots.  Therefore, I would give the camera very high marks for landscape photography.  As for a price/performance assessment, I bought the camera from the Outlet as a scratch/dent deal, and as near as I can tell it was the box and not the camera that was marked, so I consider it to be a screaming deal for what I paid.  Two minor issues- the software defaults to downloading all of the images on the memory card, even the ones previously downloaded, and battery life appears to be a lot less than suggested. For those looking for a camera to tote around and take random pictures that come out clear and crisp with a minimum of fuss, I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Scott Hall
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a few months now and I am very happy with it. The pictures it takes are amazing and in good light they look just as good as my friends Cannon DSLR, in low light his wins out but for the $800 difference I think I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: For those of you replacing a 3-4 year old camera, it's tough to beat this
Reviews.Author: Honest O'Pinion
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony DSC-P9, which was all the rage a long time ago when I got it - after all, it had 4 whole megapixels.I decided it was time to replace the camera, and I didn't want to spend anywhere near what I did on my Sony.This camera works great as a replacement for an older digital point-and-shoot.  Images are clearer, there arefewer chromatic aberrations at higher ISO ratings than older cameras, and low-light performance is better.Time to shoot/flash recharge/etc. are marginally better. It is compact, but unlike my old camera it feelslike I could comfortably take a shot or two with one hand.  This is due to its shape and the grip on the front.There is the ubiquitous auto mode, but there are more manual settings if you wish to try them out. It usesAA batteries which I prefer.  The movies it takes are about average.  You might see tearing/choppiness when viewingon your computer, but I think it's the codec/video drivers' fault, since it doesn't happen when playing back onthe little LCD.  To be fair, I haven't tried installing the software they sent with the camera yet either.This is nowhere near the best point-and-shoot digital on the market today.  Other cameras will beat this onein about every category.  If you want to pay the same price you did for that last camera that is.  If you arenot trying to be a professional photographer and haven't bought a digital camera in 4 or more years, this willbe a huge improvement on your last camera in every way and easy on the pocketbook. You're getting a good camerafor the price.  If you're trying to replace the camera you bought 6 months ago, pay the extra money and buy somethinga step or two up from this.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: Divyakumar Arora "Dev Arora"
Reviews.Content: This camera works really well. I hate that it takes a little while to reload itself after taking a picture. It is not ready instantly as other cameras. I also hate the fact you have to change the batteries everytime. Rest all is perfect. Takes awesome pictures.Just because of those two things I rate it 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: A reasonably good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: AAF "AAF"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes pretty good pictures, but nothing you'd be able to sell to National Geographic.  It's hampered by a relatively slow lens (f/3.3) and a weak flash. Picture color is good.  Camera fits nicely in a shirt pocket.  You will need to buy a SD memory card, and, probably at least 4 rechargeable AA batteries as well.The instruction manual is a mixed bag.  It gives great detail on how set up each feature, but no guidance on when you would want to use the feature.  A few examples:- When to use image stabilizer mode 1 and when 2?- When to use P (programmed) or when to use iA (intelligent Automatic)?- Which auto focusing modes to use? (There is no manual focus.)The DMC-LZ10B is the same camera in black.

Reviews.Title: The camera has issues
Reviews.Author: William Haas
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to be a carry around in my pocket when I don't want to haul my other, bulkier cameras.  The picture quality is usually excellent, the features are easy to use and learn. The problems are these: 1) a few pictures are distorted with circles that are not in the picture before or after. 2) the thumb wheel has free movement and any touch will move the wheel. Then you look down and you are in a different setting than the one you set/wanted.  You may lose pictures you thought you had. 3)The flash is too sensitive and fires often, for example on cloudy days.  Overall I am happy with the quality of the pictures, but the problems are a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: sturdy feel
Reviews.Author: mamumann3 "Dort"
Reviews.Content: I like the way this camera feels in my hands. The picture quality is very good. I am disappointed in the ISO feature. The battery life is only fair. An instruction video would be helpful. This is my second digital point and shoot camera and I find it harder to use than the Kodak EasyShare. Granted, there are more features on the Panasonic but the navigation is not as simple as I had expected. I was tempted to send it back, but decided to spend more time and learn to use it. If you are willing to be patient and work through the rough places I would say it is an adequate camera.

Reviews.Title: A Little Camera that Could
Reviews.Author: HK
Reviews.Content: This camera packs a lot of functions in a compact device. Among which is bracketing, an extremely rare feature on a compact.

Reviews.Title: Great Xmas present
Reviews.Author: Azon40
Reviews.Content: Got one of these for christmas last year and I couldnt do without it. I cant praise this camera enough, everything about it is amazing and it takes razor sharp images instantly. A lot of other portable digital cameras take ages to process the shot, not the dmc-lz10k it's out the pocket and boom snap taken. It's just great for everyday photography and takes a very professional shot without the expense of a full on digital SLR. Too many features to mention here but for anyone just looking for a high quality camera at a good price then go no further your home.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Arizona Javaman "Jerry62"
Reviews.Content: I had one of these for 2 years and then broke the display - my fault.  This reviewed item is a replacement, a used one at 1/3 the price of the new one.  Works just like new.  This  model has many good features but particularly I like the extent of the wide angle shots.  It is aging technology in the fast moving world of cameras, but for the money spent I felt it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: Tough Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Beaudet "blackbird04217"
Reviews.Content: I had the Lumix DMZ LZ7 for a couple years, and it survived falling 7 feet onto hard linoleum floors twice, and walked with me for 1600 miles of my adventure along the Appalachian Trail where it finally got wet enough to give up.  I turned to the same model for it's proven toughness and was not disappointed.This camera finished the remaining 600 miles, and has been used as my go to camera since I bought it mid-2009.  It is great that it takes simple AA batteries, which can also be acquired as rechargeables.  This makes it easy to still have access to the camera if away from home and no special charger is needed.  Durability has amazed me in both this and the previous 7mp model.  It has been dirty, wet, and handling all elements extremely well.  And the price?!  Amazing deal.A point that I will take away, is hooking it to the computer via USB.  It does not power the camera through the USB cord, which is unfortunate.  I managed to kill a pair of AA batteries by thinking it would be powered by the computer.  Instead of copying the files over then looking, I was just browsing through the camera until the connection died.  This has never been an issue since, but it is something to be forewarned about.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, one of the last using AA batteries
Reviews.Author: Severo C. Wong
Reviews.Content: I consider myself as an old fashion individual.  Although I have Nikon D60, D5000, and some other Panasonic camera models, this one is great because its specs.  As there were no new cameras of this model in Amazon, I decided to buy the used LZ10 camera from EZCORP on Amazon, and IS in great condition as advertised, BUT NOBody said that settings were in JAPANESE, because somehow it is for Japan home use device and ended in the US, and for incredible it seems, this camera cannot Change Language in the menu. Can you believe it?.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: ALVARO PALACHE
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT PRODUCT AND GOOD SERVICE PROVIDED BY YOUR TEAM, THEY ARE TRULY RELIABLE AND TIMELY I WILL RECOMMEND THIS PROVIDER AMONG MY FRIENDS.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: NYGL6511 "nygl"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for over 3 years now and havent had any problems with it except one a few days ago which I was able to solve on my own quickly. The issue was with the lense not going back in and the camera saying to turn it off and then on again but the camera did not get fixed that way. I found a solution online which was to trace the inside of the lense with a paper and that worked. The camera is great, shoot great night pictures as well. Small and not heavy.

Reviews.Title: Bought It For the Wide Angle Lens... & the Price
Reviews.Author: J. Meadors "J Meadors"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically because it had a wider angle lens than most other point and shoots out there in the same price range.  As someone who shoots mostly indoor pics in tight spaces (a shoot a lot of apartment interiors), I need the widest possible lens I can get.  And in that regard, this camera works very well.I've had the camera for about a year now and I have it on me pretty much every single day.  I take a lot of pics--sometimes 50 a day--and this camera has never even given me so much as a hiccup.My only complaint about this camera--and it can be said of MOST cameras in this price range--is that it does not take very good pics in low light situations w/o a flash.  And I'm not talking about night time or anything... early evening outside or even day time inside in a room without much natural light.  Again this is a common problem but I HAVE seen / used other cameras that did not have this problem--namely the Canon digital Elphs and Powershots (not all but the mid-to-higher end ones).  Again, the main reason I bought this camera over those was price and the wide-angle lens.  So, to get something I needed I had to give up something I guess.With just a tiny bit of photo editing (mainly contrast and color balancing), 90% of the images you get from this camera will give you what you need (so long as they are not low light pics w/o a flash).  The wide angle takes good panoramic shots-though not at a very high resolution.Oh!  One more reason I bought this camera over other similar cameras was the AA batteries over a proprietary battery.  For some reason I have always preferred the former since batteries are cheap and plentiful.  I just rotate through two pairs of rechargeable AAs and I get plenty of working time from those.  Overall I give this camera a 4 out of 5 for what it is.  I knock of 1 star for the poor low light images and overall slightly lower quality images than I have achieved with other similar cameras.

Reviews.Title: easy to use and takes quality photos
Reviews.Author: Dee Z
Reviews.Content: this was purchased for my college daughter and she loves it! Easy to use and takes quality photos

Reviews.Title: Great Camera...
Reviews.Author: Danilo Sosa
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, the quality of picture is excellent, all the features are amazing...The IA mode is very good, the scenes mode is the best, you can choice from many differents modes according to the picture you want... The optical zoom and the extended zoom are very nice, the antishake system works very well, the quality of video is very good, everything is perfect... You don't need to be an expert to take good pictures... The LZ10 makes everything for you...

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot and much more!!!!
Reviews.Author: E. ANTWORTH
Reviews.Content: This is and excellent camera. The Leica lens is a star performer for sure. Ease of point and shoot and much more for the more experienced or inspired photographer.Despite what the manual reccomends, Lithium batteries are the best option for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix Quality
Reviews.Author: John R. Dombrosky "AMC bybirth"
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Panasonic Lumix I have bought. I bought this compact for my wife based on the quality and value of the Panasonic Lumix brand cameras.I have owned the Panasonic Lumix DMZ-F27 for 3 years and really appreciate the ease and quality. My wife is still working on using her Panasonic Lumix DMC-LZ10K and really likes what the camera has to offer!

Reviews.Title: Great camera when the price is right
Reviews.Author: D. H Mark
Reviews.Content: The price on this camera has been fluctuating a lot.  when it is less than $110 it is hard to beat for the combination of features.  Probably not a good deal for greater than $150.I agree with many positive reviews, just want to highlight some pertinent negatives for some users.Lens is relatively slow (3.3- 5.9), so in low light the ISO will be bumped up a lot, producing grainier pictures.  However, there is an extremely nice "auto ISO" mode, where you can select the maxiumum ISO you want the camera to automatically select.Like many AA battery cameras, it is slow to recharge flash, thus do not expect to shoot rapid fire flash shots.  According to other reviews, battery life is great, though.It is not particularly fast between shots.There is an odd "backlight" reminder that shows up on the screen all the time, reminding you to push one of the buttons if you have a backlight situation.  Seems like kind of an afterthought, after they decided they could not automate a backlight exposure situation (some cameras do this when the focussed object is darker than the rest of the image).No viewfinder, but this is a rarely missed feature (but I need sometimes).At a good price, this is an awesome camera with excellent choice of zoom range (130-150), excellent quality photos, good construction.  All around fantastic camera with perfect choice of features for a cheap compact.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, versatile camera for a reasonable
Reviews.Author: SWA
Reviews.Content: The goal was to get a high-quality, easy to carry, no-hassles, flexible camera capable of capturing images excellently. The Panasonic LZ10K is all those things and then some. DPreview included its 8 Mb sibling in a roundup test of point-and-shoots a year ago, and the LZ8K earned top honors. After using the camera for several weeks, it's easy to understand why.The LZ10K is well designed and comfortable to use. Everything is right where it should be and works splendidly. That includes the menu system. The camera manual -- kudos to Panasonic for actually providing a printed manual -- is decent, although loaded as it is with icons and other symbols, it would be nice if it were a bit larger. (I can't judge the included software because I haven't used it.)I rate the LZ10K with four out of five stars for features for one reason: it lacks an optical viewfinder. The LCD is big, bright and contrasty. It gains up well in low light. But even so there are times when a little window to look through would be much more helpful. So would being able to brace the camera against my face. What could it add to the cost, $5, $10, $15? I'd gladly pay that difference.There was one other minor letdown. The fact the LZ10K has full manual capability was a big selling point. However, I'm disappointed the camera switches to ISO 100 in manual mode and there's no way to change it. I would love to be able to at least set it to ISO 400 or 800, in addition to the ISO 100 default.Still, those two feature issues won't keep me from recommending the LZ10K. The price is remarkably reasonable for a camera this well made and designed, and one that delivers images of this quality. If anything were to happen to this LZ10K, I'd buy another without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: Nice point and shoot
Reviews.Author: A. Hopper
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a backup for when I am going to a place I dont want to take my larger Nikon d60.  As for what it is advertised to do it does do the job.  Its a nice alternative to the nikon when I can't bring it.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because to two things.  First, it takes a lot a battery power, and when I say a lot I mean A LOT!  My rechargable batteries only last a max of about 3-4 hours.  So make sure you pack some extra batteries when planning on making a day of taking photos. Also I had some technical difficulties in that when I asked the camera to do some of the higher functioning tasks in the A/S/M setting it would just lock down and start blinking, the only way to remedy it was to turn it off and leave it off for about 10-15 seconds.  So this could be a big deal when swithching from different modes quickly to get that "one" shot.  But all in all I am happy with my purchase, and would recomend it for the price.

Reviews.Title: true, excellent
Reviews.Author: G. MD "weekend handyman"
Reviews.Content: The camera has been out more than one year, I have used mine for over one month. Bought it from Amazon affilate for $99.High quality, smaller and thinner than expected, like to think of it as a cheap Canon G11 alternative.  Have so far only had brief use of manual control.  Quality of the pictures are excellent.  Ideal camera for advanced amateur for a shockingly budget price.gychang

Reviews.Title: excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: J. E. Meyer
Reviews.Content: The quality of the pictures is just amazing. And it is small enough to take on walks and jogs. I wish sometimes that it would focus faster, but it is a small price to pay for perfectly focused, gorgeous photographs.

Reviews.Title: Very flexible point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Antonio Nolan
Reviews.Content: Was luck enough to buy this few weeks ago when it was $99.99. Unit arrived on time. Great photos although havent printed them out yet or downloaded to computer. Lots of nice features like the 5x optical zoom, manual controls available aside from Auto. Lots of flexibility. Anti-shake function too. Downside is flimsy, plastic, matte construction. User manual has some flaws in terms of clarity. Hard to find a matching camera case though. Runs on AA-batteries which is great when you run out of charge. Just go to nearest to store instead of having to charge a lithium-ion or polymer battery and wait for a long time. A great first-time Panasonic Lumix purchase for me. Strongly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for a casual user.  Great price. Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Wild Orchid XXX "Fashion Addict"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my mother for her birthday; she was long overdue a digital camera upgrade (say 7 years late).  I read the reviews and got the camera based on them.  I think the reviews were right on the money. The quality is good, the picture is more than acceptable and it is easy to use the basic functions and setup.  I did not get to explore the video capabilities with her nor the wide angle feature (sill do on her Thanksgiving visit).I like everything about it EXCEPT the delay in between pictures; this is why I gave it 4 stars vs 5.  But I will emphasize that is just my rating, I am pretty sure my mom would give the whole 5.I recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: works for me, cant beat it for the price.
Reviews.Author: Les Moore "austintexican"
Reviews.Content: This is a video I made the first week I got the camera. -Check out "The Brake Job" on [...]

Reviews.Title: The best USER FRIENDLY CAMERA I have ever used
Reviews.Author: Vishnu Vijayaraghavan "states of being"
Reviews.Content: After researching compact cameras for 2 weeks, I had narrowed down my choices to this camera. As with most electronic purchases I make, it was an agonizing process. Every camera had a feature that I wanted, yet none of them had everything that I wanted and operating the camera would be difficult with other camera's. This is a user friendly camera.It is very easy to use.I am giving one this for my father.Any one can use this easily and all the features is there in this camera for such a cheap price.As for the performance,I am very happy.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Villa Library
Reviews.Content: I usually use a DSLR, but did not want to lug a big camera for a two-week trip. The Panasonic Lumix DMC LZ10 was a nice (and inexpensive) stand-in. This camera is small (pocket-sized), and took good pictures both indoors and outdoors, in either daylight or darkness.  I wanted a camera that uses AA batteries - using NiMh rechargeables and carrying an "emergency" set of long-life lithium disposables worked well.  Used as back-up, one set of lithiums lasted the whole trip and still have juice.  The Lumix DMC LZ10 is not as good as my SLR, but lots easier to carry. I was satisfied with most of my pictures, proud of some.  Also, it's sturdy.  I'm embarassed to say I dropped it twice, and it still worked fine. Disadvantages are: 1. only a 5X zoom, 2. blank screen and fairly (sometimes several seconds) long re-set between pictures. My husband's Canon Powershot SX110IS also uses AA batteries.  It's a little bigger than the Panasonic, but it has a 10X zoom, and it did a better job on the long-distance shots.

Reviews.Title: LUMIX Camera
Reviews.Author: H. C. Keith
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of this model for my department at work.  I loved them so much, I bought one for home, just in a different color.  Easy to use, great photos that enlarge easily, and clearly.  Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Extremely Slow Between Shots & NOT Consistent Quality
Reviews.Author: Z. Ye "22"
Reviews.Content: I purhcased this camera because it was on sale and I gave it a try.  Because I have a big Canon DSLR 40D, and my previous Canon SD750 was dropped into sand and lense cannot be retracted.  Thus, I bought this one, althought it has a lot of great reviews (now I wonder WHY).  This camera is EXTREMELY slow between shots, it needs 4-5 seconds in order to take the next shot (this has nothing to do with my SD card, I am using a class 6), this is VERY frustrating.  Plus, picture quality is NOT consistent, you can get great shot if you are lucky and the object can stand-still for 10 seconds.Long story short, it does not perform as Panasonic described.  Make sure you can return it easily before you try.  Before this, I also tried Panasonic FS15, which also returned.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy !
Reviews.Author: John Lewis
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a present and my non techy girlfriend loves it, so I love it  ! Excellent pictures and that's what it is all about !!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-LZ
Reviews.Author: tjh22
Reviews.Content: Camera works fine. You will need a SD card as it only holds ~ 5 pictures taking them at 5 megapixel.

Reviews.Title: lumix lz10
Reviews.Author: 3menda
Reviews.Content: Everything I was looking for in a camera. Shipping was on time and everything was in perfect condition

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for a low price
Reviews.Author: Gilberto Grafals
Reviews.Content: Is easy to use and loaded with fun features. Great price for a reliable camera.

Reviews.Title: Beware Panasonic's Repair/Replacement Process
Reviews.Author: James Slotta
Reviews.Content: Seven months after purchasing and receiving a Lumix DMC LZ-10S I still have not received a camera that works.  I have received two defective replacement cameras.  I have wasted hours talking to Panasonic technical support and shipping defective cameras to them for repair/replacement.  I have traveled on vacation only to discover that my replacement camera doesn't work.  I have even been told that I might have to accept a replacement camera - the third one I've received so far - that is a different model, with different features, from the one I bought seven month ago.  Panasonic does not offer refunds.  I am exhausted.I purchased a Panasonic Lumix DMC LZ-10S in August 2009.  The camera worked the first couple of times I used it, but then the lens would no longer focus, it would retract and the screen would go blank.  I spoke to Panasonic technical support, who had me return the camera for repair/replacement.  I was then sent a refurbished camera whose lens cover would not open.  I returned that camera and was again sent a refurbished camera.  This camera had the same problems that the first camera had.When I spoke to technical support I was told that I should ship the camera in and that a note was being included with my case saying that a supervisor should contact me concerning a refund.  After three defective cameras that seemed appropriate.  Instead, after returning the camera Panasonic sent a different model camera (DMC-FS15S)to me - a camera that did not take AA batteries, which was one of the primary reasons I purchased the LZ-10S.  I contacted Panasonic again about why I had never been contacted by a supervisor and was told that Panasonic policy was to not give refunds and that the women I had spoken to previously had not left a note for a supervisor to contact me.I was also told that Panasonic may or may not exchange the FS15S they sent me for a camera that takes AA batteries - under the terms of the warranty they are not required to replace a defective camera with the same model.  I will hear from them in the next couple of days.  Panasonic products may be good or bad, but their repair/replacement policies and service are something to consider before buying a product from them.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix Digial Camera
Reviews.Author: Corey Worrell
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera, very easy to use and very light.the picture quality seems muh better than 10mp.a must buy, for a non professional or professional

Reviews.Title: Had to send it back
Reviews.Author: Raymond E. Baycar "RayBay"
Reviews.Content: Pictures taken in sunlight were fine but all the pictures using the flash had multiple reflection spots all over the images.  The front of the lens was clean.  The camera seems excessively slow to focus and shoot even in sunlight without the flash so I missed nearly all my moving dog picture attempts.  I got 32 pictures from two NiMH battery charges; maybe the batteries were bad.  I sent the camera back.  I do better with my wife's old Canon A80.  Essex was very good about the return and full refund including return postage.

Reviews.Title: My camera
Reviews.Author: Kay A. "love2bake"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last month. Haven't had the chance to experiment much. So far, the only downside is lack of view finder. I love this camera. Has great quality picture. Sharp little thing!

Reviews.Title: exelent pocket camera
Reviews.Author: El Oso
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I wanted to supplement my SLR. Takes great pics if you take the time to learn to fineness it. Does alright as a point and shoot for dummies.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: kelley
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping! product is wonderful! I owned the 8MP and wanted to upgrade!! Great Product!!

Reviews.Title: Excelente Cámara
Reviews.Author: M. C. G. Guillen "T¿k@"
Reviews.Content: La cámara actualmente está en Mérida Venezuela, tiene una resolución excelente, es cómoda y super sencilla de utilizar... Todavía la estoy probando, porque tiene muchos detalles y opciones... El estabilizador de imagenes, toda toda es genial. Yo le compre una memoria de 4Gb y la capacidad de fotos es super. Si quieres comprar una cámara te la recomiendo 100%... Saludos Marta

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Georgina Candia
Reviews.Content: everything was perfect, the shipping did not take too long either and I love the camera

Reviews.Title: Don/t buy it!!
Reviews.Author: Jorge F. Sousa
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely slow in taking pictures.  It can take 5-7 seconds between pictures especially inside or at night.  Extremely frustrating!!!  I emailed costumer service at Panasonic if this was normal for the camera and received a response directing me to call instead.  I have made two calls, waited on the line for 10 min each, no live person responded and I hung up.  Buy something else.
